title: (x) Palatino-like "Gybing" - Palatino (pre-digital) {Paul Stanley}
content:
What's this, its not Platino?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221959im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32887.gif)   
   
Thank you
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content: Is it a sample from metal? The metal version of Palatino did have a y like this: [as seen here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221959/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/PALATINO01.GIF).
There are different versions of Palatino. It seems that every time it moves to a different typesetting technology, Zapf uses it as an opportunity to redo it.

Also, before digital type, the display versions of Palatino differed from the text versions. Here is one that matches Jonathan's sample (Palatino Semi-Bold, from Phil's Photo Homage to the Alphabet):   
   
 ![palatino](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221959im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32911.gif)   
   
This was a typositor font. Letraset also had this version, if I remember correctly.
